title: WPKernel Config
description: Configuration for the WPKernel CLI (wpk.config.ts). This file describes how your WordPress plugin is wired: namespace, shared schemas, resources with REST routes, storage in posts/taxonomies/options/transients, capabilities, and optional admin UI.

$schema.description: Optional JSON Schema URI used by editors and tooling. Ignored by WPKernel at runtime.

version.description: Configuration schema version. Must be set to 1 for this version of the WPKernel toolchain.

namespace.description: Short, slug-style identifier for this plugin or feature. Used as a prefix for generated PHP namespaces, JS store keys, and WordPress capability names (for example, "jobs", "catalog", "bookings").

schemas.description: Registry of shared schema descriptors, keyed by a short name. These are typically JSON Schema files that define request/response shapes for one or more resources.

resources.description: Registry of resource descriptors keyed by identifier. Each resource represents one WordPress-facing domain object (for example, a job listing, booking, or menu item) and drives REST routes, storage strategy (posts/taxonomies/options/transients), capabilities, and admin UI.

adapters.description: Optional adapter factories that customise the code WPKernel generates. These are advanced hooks for overriding low-level PHP/JS details rather than day-to-day plugin configuration.

php.description: Factory that returns PHP codegen overrides (for example, changing namespaces or adding extra includes). Most plugins do not need this.

extensions.description: Adapter extension factories that run during generation to patch or extend the default adapters. Use this when you want to add custom behaviour without forking WPKernel itself.

readiness.description: Optional readiness helper factories that plug into the WPKernel "doctor" command. Use this to add custom health checks for your plugin or hosting environment.

helpers.description: List of factories that WPKernel calls when building the readiness registry. Each factory can register one or more custom health checks.

function.description: Executable factory or callback. In practice this is a JavaScript/TypeScript function exported from your wpk.config.ts file.

path.description: Relative path (from the plugin root) to the source schema file (for example, a JSON Schema or Zod schema).

types.description: Relative path where WPKernel should write the generated TypeScript types for this schema.

generated.description: Configuration for code that WPKernel generates from this schema, typically TypeScript types.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this schema models (for example, "Public job listing API payload").

schemaConfig.description: Describes a single shared schema file and where its generated types should be written.

path.description: REST API route path relative to the namespace (for example, "/jobs" or "/jobs/(?P<id>\\d+)").

method.description: HTTP method used for this route, matching how WordPress registers REST endpoints.

capability.description: WordPress capability string required to call this route (for example, "jobs_read" or "manage_options"). If omitted, WPKernel falls back to the resource-level capabilities.

resourceRoute.description: Definition for a single REST API endpoint that WPKernel will register via WordPress's REST API.

resourceRoutes.description: Named REST routes for the resource. Common operations like list/get/create/update/remove map to typical CRUD endpoints, and you can also define extra routes by name.

type.description: Numeric identity for this resource, usually a WordPress post ID.

param.description: Name of the route parameter that carries the numeric ID. For WordPress posts this is almost always "id".

resourceIdentityNumber.description: Identity configuration for resources addressed by numeric IDs (for example, WP posts).

type.description: String identity for this resource, such as a slug or UUID.

param.description: Name of the route parameter used to look up the resource (for example, "slug" for custom post types that are addressed by slug).

resourceIdentityString.description: Identity configuration for resources addressed by string keys (slugs, UUIDs, etc.).

resourceIdentity.description: How this resource is uniquely identified in REST routes and storage: by numeric ID (post ID) or by a string key (slug/UUID).

mode.description: Store data in WordPress transients rather than posts/taxonomies/options. Best for short-lived or cache-like data.

resourceStorageTransient.description: Configuration for resources that are stored entirely in WordPress transients.

type.description: PHP value type stored in post meta for this field.

single.description: Whether this meta key stores a single value (true) or multiple values (false), mirroring the $single flag in get_post_meta().

resourceStoragePostMeta.description: Shape of a single post meta field used by the resource's storage.

taxonomy.description: Taxonomy slug (for example, "category", "post_tag", or a custom taxonomy).

hierarchical.description: Whether the taxonomy behaves like categories (true) or tags (false).

register.description: If true, WPKernel will register this taxonomy for you when generating the plugin.

resourceStoragePostTaxonomy.description: Configuration describing a taxonomy relationship on a post-based resource.

mode.description: Indicates that this resource is stored as a WordPress post type.

postType.description: Custom post type slug to use for this resource.

statuses.description: Allowed post statuses for this resource (for example, ["publish", "draft"]).

supports.description: Core WordPress features to enable for the post type, mirroring the `supports` argument in register_post_type().

meta.description: Map of meta keys to their storage configuration for this post type.

taxonomies.description: Map of taxonomy slugs to their configuration for this post type.

resourceStoragePost.description: Configuration for resources modelled as custom post types in WordPress.

mode.description: Indicates that this resource is stored as a WordPress taxonomy term.

taxonomy.description: Taxonomy slug used to store this resource (for example, "category" or a custom taxonomy).

hierarchical.description: Whether the taxonomy is hierarchical (like categories) or flat (like tags).

resourceStorageTaxonomy.description: Configuration for resources stored as taxonomy terms.

mode.description: Indicates that this resource is stored in the WordPress options table.

option.description: Option name used to store this resource.

resourceStorageOption.description: Configuration for resources stored in the WordPress options table.

resourceStorage.description: Where WordPress will actually store data for this resource: transients, posts, taxonomies, or options.

capability.description: Full WordPress capability name (for example, "jobs_read" or "jobs_edit_own"). WPKernel will generate helpers that reference this capability.

appliesTo.description: Whether this capability is checked at the collection level ("resource", for example "can list jobs") or per-object ("object", for example "can edit this specific job").

binding.description: Optional key describing how this capability binds to WordPress (for example, a meta capability mapping). This is mainly for advanced capability setups.

resourceCapabilityDescriptor.description: Detailed capability configuration for a single operation, mapping your resource permissions onto WordPress's capability system.

resourceCapabilities.description: Map of operation keys (for example, "list", "get", "create", "update", "remove") to the WordPress capabilities required to perform them. Each entry can be a simple capability string or a detailed descriptor.

type.description: Base type of the query parameter. "enum" indicates that the parameter must be one of a fixed set of string values.

optional.description: Whether this query parameter is optional.

description.description: Human-readable explanation of how this query parameter is used (for example, "Filter jobs by status").

resourceQueryParamDescriptor.description: Descriptor for a single query parameter accepted by this resource's REST API routes.

resourceQueryParams.description: Map of query parameter names to their descriptors, defining the supported query-string filters for this resource.

resourceCacheKeys.description: Optional functions that compute cache keys for the resource's REST calls. Use this to integrate with custom caching layers (for example, a CDN or object cache) while keeping the logic close to the resource definition.

getId.description: Function that returns the unique ID for a given item in the client-side store.

getQueryKey.description: Function that returns a stable query key for a given list/query, used by client-side caching libraries.

initialState.description: Initial client-side state for this resource's store, if you need to seed it with defaults.

resourceStore.description: Optional configuration for the client-side store used by the generated JS/TS helpers for this resource.

slug.description: Menu slug used when registering the admin page for this resource.

title.description: Menu title shown in the WordPress admin sidebar.

capability.description: Capability required to see this admin menu (for example, "manage_options" or a resource-specific capability).

parent.description: Parent menu slug if this screen should live under an existing menu (for example, "options-general.php").

position.description: Numeric menu position, following WordPress's admin menu conventions.

resourceDataViewsMenu.description: Configuration for the WordPress admin menu entry that will host this resource's Data Views screen.

component.description: Name of the React component used to render the Data Views screen.

route.description: Admin route or hash route where this screen is mounted.

resourceImport.description: Import path for the generated resource client.

resourceSymbol.description: Named export used for the generated resource client.

wpkernelImport.description: Import path for WPKernel's UI helpers.

wpkernelSymbol.description: Named export used for WPKernel's UI helpers.

resourceDataViewsScreen.description: Low-level wiring details for the admin Data Views screen that WPKernel generates for this resource.

id.description: Stable identifier for this saved view (for example, "open-jobs").

label.description: Label shown in the UI for this saved view.

view.description: Configuration object describing filters/sorts/layout for this saved view. The exact shape is defined by the Data Views integration.

description.description: Optional longer description shown in tooltips or documentation.

isDefault.description: Whether this saved view should be the default when the screen first loads.

resourceDataViewsSavedView.description: Represents a saved view in the resource's Data Views UI (for example, "Open jobs" or "Draft posts").

feature.description: Interactivity feature flag used by the Data Views integration. Defaults to "admin-screen".

resourceDataViewsInteractivity.description: Fine-grained switches for Data Views interactivity; most plugins can rely on the defaults.

fields.description: Field definitions for the Data Views table/list. Each entry describes a column or UI field.

defaultView.description: Default Data Views configuration when the screen first loads.

actions.description: Action definitions (row/bulk actions) available from the Data Views UI.

mapQuery.description: Optional function that maps Data Views query state into your REST query parameters.

search.description: Whether to show the search box for this Data Views screen.

searchLabel.description: Label to use for the search input, if enabled.

getItemId.description: Function that extracts the unique ID from a row item.

empty.description: Optional configuration for the empty-state UI when there are no items.

perPageSizes.description: List of page sizes the user can pick from in the Data Views UI.

defaultLayouts.description: Default layout configuration keyed by layout type (for example, table vs grid).

views.description: List of saved views available from the Data Views UI.

preferencesKey.description: Key used to store user preferences for this Data Views screen (for example, in user meta).

interactivity.description: Interactivity configuration for this Data Views instance.

screen.description: Screen and menu wiring for the Data Views UI.

resourceDataViews.description: Configuration for the WordPress admin Data Views UI generated for this resource.

view.description: Identifier for the admin view associated with this resource (for example, a React route name).

dataviews.description: Data Views configuration for this resource's admin screen.

resourceAdminUI.description: Top-level configuration for how this resource appears in the WordPress admin UI.

admin.description: Admin-only UI configuration for this resource.

resourceUI.description: UI configuration for the resource. At present this mostly focuses on WordPress admin screens.

name.description: Human-readable name for this resource (for example, "Job" or "Booking"). This is used in generated code and logs.

namespace.description: Optional override for the REST namespace segment for this resource. Defaults to the top-level namespace if omitted.

routes.description: REST API routes that expose this resource via WordPress's REST API.

identity.description: How this resource is identified in URLs and storage (post ID, slug, UUID, etc.).

storage.description: Where and how WordPress stores this resource's data (posts, taxonomies, options, transients).

cacheKeys.description: Optional cache-key functions for integrating this resource with external caches.

queryParams.description: Query-string parameters that can be used when calling this resource's REST routes.

store.description: Client-side store configuration for generated JS/TS helpers.

schema.description: Schema for the resource's data. This can be a reference to a shared schema key, an inline schema object, or a factory function that returns a schema.

reporter.description: Optional reporter object or factory used for logging and diagnostics specific to this resource.

ui.description: UI configuration, primarily for the WordPress admin, associated with this resource.

capabilities.description: Mapping between high-level operations on this resource and the WordPress capabilities that guard them. This is where you connect your domain permissions to WordPress's capability system.

resourceConfig.description: Defines a single resource exposed by your plugin: its name, REST routes, WordPress storage strategy, capabilities, and optional admin UI.
